docs.lead_paragraph: The disputed study found a high prevalence of diabetes in countries with a high use of fructose corn syrup.

headline.seo: New Scrutiny for Diabetes and Sweeteners

docs.abstract: Study to be published in Global Public Health finds higher prevalence of diabetes in 43 countries with a high use level of fructose corn syrup; Corn Refiners Assn attacks study as severely flawed and misleading.
docs.snippet: The disputed study found a high prevalence of diabetes in countries with a high use of fructose corn syrup.

docs.lead_paragraph: Do many germs escape into the air when a toilet is flushed, and do they affect our health?

headline.seo: Does Flushing a Toilet Release Germs Into the Air?

docs.abstract: Science Q&A on whether germs escape into the air when a toilet is flushed.
docs.snippet: Do many germs escape into the air when a toilet is flushed, and do they affect our health?

headline.main: Low Vitamin D Level Tied to Type 1 Diabetes
headline.print_headline: Patterns: Low Vitamin D Level Tied to Type 1 Diabetes

docs.abstract: Researchers found that subjects with low blood levels of vitamin D were more likely to develop diabetes than those with higher levels.
docs.snippet: Researchers found that subjects with low blood levels of vitamin D were more likely to develop diabetes than those with higher levels.

headline.main: Former SAC Trader to Appear in Court

docs.abstract: The latest alumnus of SAC Capital Advisors is set to appear in federal court in Manhattan on Monday. | How the family of China's prime minister grew wealthy from an investment in Ping An Insurance. | A trading loss at UBS has led to a fine of £29.7 million. | Qatar Holding has sold its remaining warrants in Barclays.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many physicians who stop accepting insurance do so because of frustration with red tape. But concierge medicine isn’t for everyone.

headline.seo: Dealing With Doctors Who Accept Only Cash
headline.main: Dealing With Doctors Who Take Only Cash

docs.lead_paragraph: A strong international treaty is needed to prevent thousands of needless deaths caused by counterfeit drugs.

headline.seo: The Problem of Fake and Useless Drugs
headline.main: The Problem of Fake and Useless Drugs
headline.print_headline: The Problem of Fake and Useless Drugs

docs.abstract: Editorial underscores need for strong international treaty, backed by governments, drug companies and nongovernmental groups, to prevent thousands of deaths caused by counterfeit drugs.
docs.snippet: A strong international treaty is needed to prevent thousands of needless deaths caused by counterfeit drugs.
